pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:5.1: 12. The training rule on light outer robes
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:6.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā was a learned reciter, and she was confident and skilled at giving teachings.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:6.3: Just then it was warm and king Pasenadi of Kosala had dressed in an expensive outer robe made of linen. He then went to Thullanandā, bowed, and sat down.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:6.4: And Thullanandā instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:6.7: “Great king, if you wish to give me something, then give me this outer robe made of linen.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:6.8: The king gave her his outer robe. He then got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated her with his right side toward her, and left.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:6.10: “These nuns have great desires; they are not content.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:6.11: How can they ask the king for his linen outer robe?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:7.2: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:7.3: “How could Venerable Thullanandā ask the king for his linen outer robe?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā asked for this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:7.7: How can the nun Thullanandā ask the king for his linen outer robe?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:8.1: ‘If a nun carries out an exchange to get a light outer robe, it is to be worth at most two-and-a-half _kaṁsa_ coins. If she gets one in exchange that is worth more than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:9.2: whatever outer robe is used in warm weather.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:10.1: Carries out an exchange to get:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:11.1: It is to be worth at most two-and-a-half _kaṁsa_ coins:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:11.2: it may be worth ten _kahāpaṇa_ coins.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:12.1: If she gets one in exchange that is worth more than that:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:12.2: if she asks for one worth more than that, then the effort constitutes wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:12.3: When she obtains it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:12.4: It is to be relinquished to the Order of nuns, a group, or an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:12.6: To be expanded as in Nuns’ Relinquishment 1, {MS.2.2431-2.2435}, with appropriate substitutions.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:12.7: ‘Venerables, this light outer robe worth more than two-and-a-half _kaṁsa_ coins which I got in exchange is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Order.’ …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:13.1: If it is worth more than two-and-a-half _kaṁsa_ coins, and she perceives it as more, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:13.2: If it is worth more than two-and-a-half _kaṁsa_ coins, but she is unsure if it is, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:13.3: If it is worth more than two-and-a-half _kaṁsa_ coins, but she perceives it as worth less than two-and-a-half _kaṁsa_ coins, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:14.1: If it is worth less than two-and-a-half _kaṁsa_ coins, but she perceives it as worth more than two-and-a-half _kaṁsa_ coins, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:14.2: If it is worth less than two-and-a-half _kaṁsa_ coins, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:14.3: If it is worth less than two-and-a-half _kaṁsa_ coins, and she perceives it as worth less than two-and-a-half _kaṁsa_ coins, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:15.10: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:16.1: The twelfth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:19.1: “Venerables, the thirty rules on offenses entailing relinquishment and confession have been recited.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:19.2: In regard to this I ask you,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:19.8: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:20.1: The chapter on offenses entailing relinquishment in the nuns’ analysis is finished.
